Logging with explicit category
[Logging]

Logging macros with an explicit category. More...

Defines

#define EV_C(category)   EV_INFO_C(category)
#define EV_FATAL_C(category)   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_FATAL, category)
#define EV_ERROR_C(category)   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_ERROR, category)
#define EV_WARN_C(category)   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_WARN, category)
#define EV_INFO_C(category)   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_INFO, category)
#define EV_DETAIL_C(category)   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_DETAIL, category)
#define EV_DEBUG_C(category)   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_DEBUG, category)
#define EV_TRACE_C(category)   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_TRACE, category)

Detailed Description

Logging macros with an explicit category.

Category is a string that refers to the topic of the log message. The macro can be used as a C++ stream. Example: EV_DETAIL("retransmissions") << "Too many retries, discarding frame" << endl;.

See also:
OPP_LOG, LogLevel, EV_STATICCONTEXT
